title: Riot needs to chill and learn the difference between toxic and whats not
body: okay so i get that riot wants to weed out toxic players from the game. but they need to determine what is really toxic and whats not. like telling your team to kill yourself or calling them garbage trash and to uninstall is obviously toxic but i literally got punished because i was being harassed by my bot lane for not roaming into a 4v2 which they decided to fight for some reason (even though they had 3 heavy cc champs ganking bot) instead of falling back to the tower, after i got a bunch of flame from my ADC i literally only said to him was. "you are thinking with a bronze mentality." and later in the game when we grouped they were 1/9 i mentioned " wow another inting bot big surprise." this is not toxic i dont think. sure its a little derogatory but to get punishment for this while people are calling their team "inbred treefuckers" is pretty messed up. like i believe there is a huge difference between the two and they should be treated separately. l even spoke to riot and he literally said i was being mean and didnt think how it would make the adc feel. like were fucking adults aren't we? if you cannot take a little constructive criticism on the internet then why are you on it? like does everyone in league of legends really need a safe space because they are special snowflakes??? like can people grow up a little bit. i feel like the only way you can not get punished is by simply muting all players in the game and not talking at all because the slightest comment will get you in trouble. its messed up to say the least, riot really needs to focus on the real toxicity thats in most of the games (homophobic remarks, racism, death threats) like thats true toxicity. like they are literally taking away freedom of speech to protect little kids or people with the mentality of little kids when there are way more serious cases to be looked at.

> [{quoted}](name=Darkmatter123123,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=9V04ikGp,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-09-02T02:18:13.037+0000)how does mentioning freedom of speech claim ignorance.

Just to address this point (and not to suggest ignorance, but simply to inform): Freedom of Speech applies specifically to the government's ability to censor speech. Private organizations are (and have always been) allowed to put restrictions on behavior within their property, be it real or virtual. Hence why if you, say, go shout slurs in your local Starbucks you will rapidly find yourself asked to leave and never return.

The same is true in the US -- you can't sue someone for using a word you don't like. But you don't have to continue to employee them, nor do you have to allow them in your venues if they're causing a disturbance. In short, Freedom of Speech does not equate to Freedom from Consequences of Speech.

yeah but you cant fire someone in Canada for freedom of expression unless its conflicting with someone else human rights (racist remarks etc...) our human rights code actually protects people from being fired in that situation

I can find no legal source that says freedom of expression in Canada applies to employers.

Generally speaking, from what I read in a quick examination of Canadian labo[u]r laws, an employer can fire an employee for any reason so long as that reason is sound and given to the employee.

Your reference to the human rights code doesn't pan out - "freedom of expression" is not protected under the classes that are to be considered as discrimination.

----
Disclaimer: I am not a lawyer and may very well be missing something, and so would appreciate references to the code if I'm incorrect.

you can be fired for any reason but if they fire you for freedom of expression that doesnt violate anothers human rights. it will be considered a wrongful dismissal and you could owe that employee compensation because firing them is considered a form of discrimation under the Human rights code unless there is just cause. someone having an opinion about something is not just cause unless that opinion is racist sexist or something similar. but if you simply sayi dont like this employees work ethic they work slow you cannot be fired for that legally. it will fall under wrongful dismissal. there was a girl who took safeway to human rights over this in my city  they fired her becaus she was "annoying" and safeway then owed her 4 years of pay on top of compensation to her feelings dignity or selfrespect.

As I point out below, "freedom of expression" is not listed as one of the protected classes.

I would appreciate a source surrounding that case - many times the news media does not give the full story. Simply disliking an employee is not just cause for firing. An employee creating tension in the workforce with their "expression" generally is in cases I've seen.

I'm not going to argue this with you.

I'll just mention that under a reading of the rule as on the website linked, being fired for being "annoying" is not protected. The law protects people from being fired based on their: "disability, age (18 or more), religion or religious creed, family status, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, race or perceived race, nationality, place of origin, ancestry, colour, receipt of public assistance, and gender identity". Considering being annoying doesn't fall under any of those, the human rights laws do not apply.

pretty much anytime you are singled out by you are employer and fired without just cause (theft, continuous breach of conduct after following vigorous progressive discipline procedures , frequent absenteeism) you are protected by the human rights code. even if you are a drug addict if you miss work to go to rehab and your work fires you you can claim disability. there is no argument you are just wrong and grasping at straws because you have no idea how laws work.
